ground_truth: The ranks of hooded men, chanting in a high hillbilly wail, intersect and shuffle like a marching band at halftime. At length, they stop in perfect formation, still chanting, to face the Imperial Wizard, who stands in front of the burning cross dressed in a red satin robe and hood trimmed with gold. An aisle leads through the middle of the formation to the burning cross, before which a gibbet has been erected. The backmost row has stopped, facing away, only a few yards from the bushes that hide Delmar, Pete, and Everett. As the chanting continues, two Klansmen lead a black man, whom they grasp by either arm, up the aisle toward the gibbet. It is indeed Tommy Johnson. Over in the bushes, Everett, Delmar, and Pete are straightening up and adjusting their appropriated robes and hoods, having disposed of the color guard. A huge roar - and now the ranks resume their chanting. The color guard hustles up the aisle to draw up behind the two men leading Tommy to the gibbet. Everett hisses. Tommy looks back over his shoulder. Everett is oblivious to the big man approaching from behind. Whoosh - arriving Big Dan whips the hood from Everett's head. Everett is exposed - in blackface. The chanting abruptly stops. The crowd is stunned. Big Dan whips off the other two hoods - Delmar and Pete, in blackface. Everett, Pete, Tommy, and Delmar, bearing the Confederate flag, are retreating across the neutral ground separating the mob of Klansmen from the burning cross. The mob pursues in full cry. When the intruders reach the foot of the cross, Delmar turns. He javelins the flagpole up and out toward the pursuing crowd. Homer Stokes is mortified. The crowd gasps and watches, heads tilted back, in silence. The only sound is the fluttering flag. Homer Stokes' eyes rise, hesitate and start to fall as the flag reaches its zenith and starts to descend. We boom down with the hurtling flag toward a sea of upturned white hoods. Dead in the middle is bareheaded Dan Teague. His arms are tensed out at his sides like a waiting kick-off returner. He squints up with his one good eye, judging distance and trajectory. From somewhere, we hear a loud BOINK, as of a wire popping. The flag flutters. The crowd is silent. Big Dan sets and WHAP! He snaps his hands up and together. He has caught the flagpole. The flag has not touched the ground. The crowd cheers. Big Dan looks around, beaming acknowledgement of the cheers. From somewhere, another BOINK. As Big Dan's look reaches front again, his smile fades. His eye tracks up - up - CREEEEEEK! The fiery cross is twisting and starting to fall.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Amidst the eerie ambiance, the ranks of hooded men chant in a high, piercing hillbilly wail that echoes across the landscape. Their movements are akin to a well-rehearsed marching band at the height of a halftime show, as they intersect and shuffle in unison. Eventually, after this precise choreography, they come to a halt, standing in immaculate formation. They continue their chanting, focusing their attention on the imposing figure of the Imperial Wizard. He stands prominently in front of a towering, burning cross, distinguished by his elaborate attire—a red satin robe and hood intricately trimmed with gold. An aisle cuts through the middle of this formation, leading directly to the burning cross, before which a menacing gibbet has been set up. The men in the backmost row have stopped, positioned facing away from the aisle, just a few yards from the bushes that serve as a hiding spot for Delmar, Pete, and Everett.

As the haunting chanting persists, two Klansmen are seen escorting a black man, gripping him firmly by each arm, as they march him up the aisle toward the ominous gibbet. This man is none other than Tommy Johnson. Meanwhile, hidden within the dense bushes, Everett, Delmar, and Pete are busily straightening themselves, adjusting their commandeered robes and hoods after having cleverly disposed of the color guard. Suddenly, a massive roar erupts, and the ranks resume their rhythmic chanting. The color guard briskly hustles up the aisle to position themselves behind the two men leading Tommy toward his fate at the gibbet. Everett, in a moment of urgency, lets out a hiss. Tommy glances back over his shoulder, sensing the tension. Unbeknownst to Everett, a large man is stealthily approaching him from behind. Without warning, there is a swift whoosh as Big Dan arrives and snatches the hood from Everett's head, leaving him exposed in blackface. 

The chanting halts abruptly. The crowd, caught off guard, is left in stunned silence. Big Dan, with a dramatic flourish, removes the hoods from Delmar and Pete, revealing their disguises in blackface. With the scene now fully revealed, Everett, Pete, Tommy, and Delmar, bearing the Confederate flag, hastily retreat across the neutral ground that separates them from the fervent mob of Klansmen and the burning cross. The mob gives chase, howling in full cry. Upon reaching the base of the cross, Delmar makes a decisive move. He hefts the flagpole and javelins it up and outward toward the pursuing throng. Homer Stokes is left in utter mortification.

The crowd collectively gasps, their heads tilted back, following the flag's trajectory in stunned silence. The only audible sound is the fluttering of the flag as it sails through the air. Homer Stokes' eyes slowly rise, then hesitate before starting to fall as the flag climbs to its peak and begins to descend. We follow the flag's downward arc toward a sea of upturned white hoods. At the center of this spectacle stands bareheaded Dan Teague, his arms outstretched tensely at his sides like a poised kick-off returner. He squints up with his one good eye, meticulously calculating the distance and trajectory. Suddenly, from somewhere in the scene, a loud BOINK reverberates, reminiscent of a wire snapping. The flag flutters momentarily. The crowd waits in tense silence. Then, with a decisive WHAP! Big Dan brings his hands up and together, successfully catching the flagpole. Not a single part of the flag touches the ground. The crowd erupts into cheers as Big Dan acknowledges the applause, beaming with pride. But then, from somewhere, another ominous BOINK echoes. As Big Dan's gaze swings forward again, his smile fades as his eye traces upward—upward—CREEEEEEK! The fiery cross is twisting, groaning under its own weight, and begins its slow descent.

test_cases.description: The ranks of hooded men chanting in a high hillbilly wail intersect and shuffle like a marching band at halftime. At length they stop in perfect formation still chanting to face the Imperial Wizard who stands in front of the burning cross dressed in a red satin robe and hood trimmed with gold. An aisle leads through the middle of the formation to the burning cross before which a gibbet has been erected. The backmost row has stopped facing away only a few yards from the bushes that hide Delmar Pete and Everett. As the chanting continues two Klansmen lead a black man whom they grasp by either arm up the aisle toward the gibbet. It is indeed Tommy Johnson. Over in the bushes Everett Delmar and Pete are straightening up and adjusting their appropriated robes and hoods having disposed of the color guard. A huge roar  and now the ranks resume their chanting. The color guard hustles up the aisle to draw up behind the two men leading Tommy to the gibbet. Everett hisses. Tommy looks back over his shoulder. Everett is oblivious to the big man approaching from behind. Whoosh  arriving. Big Dan whips the hood from Everett's head. Everett is exposed  in blackface. The chanting abruptly stops. The crowd is stunned. Big Dan whips off the other two hoods. Delmar and Pete in blackface. Everett Pete Tommy and Delmar bearing the Confederate flag are retreating across the neutral ground separating the mob of Klansmen from the burning cross. The mob pursues in full cry. When the intruders reach the foot of the cross Delmar turns. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The swarms of masked children, howling in a low pirate growl, zigzag and skip like a parade float at midnight. Eventually, they halt in chaotic disarray, still howling, to face the Noble King, who stands beneath the glowing lantern draped in a blue velvet cape and mask adorned with silver. A path winds through the center of the disarray to the glowing lantern, beside which a platform has been constructed. The outermost line has paused, looking backward, just a few steps from the trees that conceal Marvin, Gene, and Hal. As the howling persists, two jesters escort a young girl, whom they grip by each hand, down the path toward the platform. It is actually Lucy Monroe. Over in the trees, Hal, Marvin, and Gene are standing up and adjusting their borrowed capes and masks, having dealt with the bouquet team. A massive shout - and now the swarms continue their howling. The bouquet team scampers down the path to assemble behind the two jesters escorting Lucy to the platform. Hal mutters. Lucy glances back over her elbow. Hal is unaware of the giant approaching from the front. Whoosh - arriving Max swings the mask from Hal's face. Hal is unveiled - with face paint. The howling abruptly ceases. The gathering is astonished. Max swings off the other two masks - Marvin and Gene, with face paint. Hal, Gene, Lucy, and Marvin, waving the pirate banner, are retreating across the open field dividing the throng of jesters from the glowing lantern. The throng pursues in loud pursuit. When the intruders reach the base of the lantern, Marvin pivots. He hurls the banner pole up and outward toward the chasing gathering. Oliver Stone is aghast. The gathering gasps and observes, heads cocked backward, in quiet. The sole noise is the rustling banner. Oliver Stone's eyes lift, pause, and start to drop as the banner reaches its peak and begins to fall. We swoop down with the soaring banner toward a mass of turned-up red masks. Dead in the center is uncovered Max Miller. His hands are stretched out at his sides like a waiting goal-line receiver. He peers up with his one sharp eye, calculating reach and flight path. From someplace, we detect a loud TWANG, as of a string snapping. The banner flutters. The gathering is quiet. Max sets and WHAM! He claps his hands up and together. He has grabbed the banner pole. The banner has not grazed the earth. The gathering applauds. Max glances around, radiating recognition of the applause. From someplace, another TWANG. As Max's view turns front again, his grin falters. His eye traces upward - upward - CREEEEEK! The shining lantern is tilting and starting to topple.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Hooded men chant in formation before the Imperial Wizard and a burning cross. A black man, Tommy Johnson, is led to a gibbet by Klansmen. Everett, Delmar, and Pete, disguised in robes, have infiltrated the scene. Big Dan reveals Everett, Pete, and Delmar are in blackface, stunning the crowd. As the trio retreats, Delmar throws a Confederate flagpole, and the mob chases them. Homer Stokes is embarrassed when the flag arcs toward Big Dan, who catches it before it hits the ground. The crowd cheers, but the cross starts to fall, casting a shadow over the scene.
